title: Code Archaeology: Forensic Analysis of Wreckit
overview: A deep-dive forensic analysis of the Wreckit codebase. Not documentation, but archaeology: tracing the evolution of key modules, identifying hidden technical debt, uncovering copy-pasted patterns, and mapping the 'DNA' of the project from its origins to the new RLM architecture.
problem_statement: Documentation describes what the code *should* do. We need to know what the code *actually* is, how it got here, and where the bodies are buried.
motivation: To understand the true state of the system after rapid evolution and self-refactoring, enabling better strategic decisions for future 'meta' improvements.
success_criteria: Comprehensive report on code evolution (Git history analysis)
Identification of top 5 technical debt hotspots
Analysis of test coverage vs. reality
technical_constraints: Must use --rlm to analyze full context
Must look at git logs, not just current HEAD
